flashy Documentation¶

butils.emptyFileTree(root)[source]¶

Empties ‘root’ folder.

butils.execute(outpath)[source]¶

qsubs the sumbit.pbs at outpath

Parameters:outpath (str) – runfolder
Returns:STDOUT, STDERR, ERRCODE
Return type:(tuple)
butils.fortParse(arg)[source]¶

returns a parsed variable from a parameter (bool, str, or number)

Parameters:arg (str) – parameter value
Returns:decorated argument for fortran parsing.
Return type:str
butils.makeGIF(runfolder, prefix='', subf='', speed=0.2)[source]¶

Join all png images within a folder in an animated .gif

Parameters:
  • runfolder (str) – folder path
  • prefix (str) – prefix for files
  • subf (str) – subfolder for files
  • speed (float) – seconds between frames
butils.probeFile(file, showrows=3)[source]¶

Shows ‘showrows’ lines from the start, midfile and ending of a plaintext file

butils.writeSubmit(subfile, code, pbsins=[], time='12:00:00', nodes=1252, ompth=16, proj='', mail='')[source]¶

builds a submit.pbs with a typical header, specifying walltime and nodes, then adding slines of code below. Exports OMP_NUM_THREADS=ompth titan: aprun (-j1) -n 1 -d 16 debug: -D (int) rhea: mpirun –map-by ppr:N:node:pe=Th or -n debug: –display-map / –report-bindings Rhea max: 48 hours on 16 nodes (2x8 core p/node: -np 256) Titan: <125 nodes 2h, <312 nodes 6h…

CGS and Nuclide module. This module can handle abundances, mass fractions and Isotope weighing.

cgs.convXmass2Abun(species, xmasses)[source]¶

Returns abundances, abar and zbar from a list of nuclide codes and mass fractions.

cgs.convertYield2Abundance(mdict, norm='H', offset=12.0)[source]¶

Turns mass yields into abundances.

cgs.elemSplit(s)[source]¶

Standalone element name spliter. (A, name) he4 -> (4, He)

cgs.fetchNuclides(flist, lowercase=True)[source]¶

filters flash otp field list, extracting species found in the checkpoint.

cgs.getAbundances(names, massfrac, scale='H', offset=12)[source]¶

Returns abundances for a list of species and mass Fractions, scaled by a set species.

cgs.getMassFractions(names, abun)[source]¶

Takes log abundances and species names to weigh them and return mass fractions. returns mass fractions.

cgs.getTotalMass(massdict)[source]¶

Sums all isotope masses in a massdict

cgs.getXYZ(masses)[source]¶

Returns Hydrogen, Helium and Metal Fractions from given mass fractions (assumes H and He at start of list).

cgs.plotAbun(ax, mdict, norm='H', offset=12.0, label='W7', color='black')[source]¶

draws abundances vs atomic number, returns label and line element for legend

cgs.plotIsoMasses(ax, mdict, label='W7', color='black', ylims=[1e-18, 1.0], notag=False)[source]¶

draws isotopic masses vs atomic mass, returns label and line element for legend

cgs.plotPfac(ax, querym, refname='/lustre/atlas/proj-shared/csc198/frivas/02.flashy/flashy/data/suncomp/AGSS09.comp', label='Sun vs Ref', norm='Si', offset=6, reftype='solar')[source]¶

draws abundquery/abundref from a massdict and a filename, types of reference are ‘solar’(for solar composition) and ‘yield’ (for other sims) returns label and line element for legend

cgs.readNuclideMasses()[source]¶

Reads an AMDC format table (Wang 2017 41 030003). AMDC atomic masses (2017): http://amdc.in2p3.fr/web/masseval.html Reads only masses, there’s more data within it so this function is extensible. output is a dict with capitalized element names, then a z and n key to access z and a keyset of N numbers.

cgs.readStandardWeights()[source]¶

Returns a species dict with standard atomic weights from: http://www.ciaaw.org/atomic-weights.htm: http://www.ciaaw.org/pubs/TSAW2013_xls.xls # CIAAW only tabulates 2013 values so no Tennessine :( and only in xls. # Abridged values. Ranges are picked on their lower end.

cgs.readSunComp(filename)[source]¶

Read a 6 column file with solar composition (Z name abundance abunerror meteoriticAb mAberror) mixes meteor and spectral/inferred abundances for completion.

cgs.readYield(filename)[source]¶

Reads a mass yield file or a zipped list (for simulation yields) Returns a mass dictionary.

cgs.speciesGrid(ax, spcodes, yoffset=5.0)[source]¶

draws a grid of the specified species on target ax.

cgs.splitSpecies(Spcodes, trueA=True)[source]¶

returns list of symbols, Z, N, A from a list of nuclide codes.(Ni56, He4, U238, …)

paramSetup.compileFLASH(runfolder, resultlines=20, slines=[], procs=8)[source]¶

calls ‘make -j procs’ at outpath, compiling the run

paramSetup.cpFLASHrun(runfolder, newrunfol)[source]¶

copy the cdx folder to a new runfolder

paramSetup.makeParDict(parfile)[source]¶

get a dictionary of parameters from a flash.par file

paramSetup.setupFLASH(module, runfolder, kwargs={'threadBlockList': 'true'}, nxb=4, nyb=8, nzb=0, geometry='cylindrical', maxbl=500, debug=False, portable=True)[source]¶

calls ./setup at _FLASH_DIR with given parameters, writing the code to destination for compiling afterwards. (must be run on a Py2.X kernel)

Parameters:
  • module (str) – name of Simulation folder to setup.
  • runfolder (str) – run folder (creates _cdx, and _otp within it).
  • kwargs (dict) – keyword arguments to setup
  • n[xyz]b (int) – cells per block for setup.
  • geometry (str) – cartesian, spherical, cylindrical(default).
  • maxbl (int) – maximum blocks per proc. elem.
  • debug (bool) – show terminal output.
oneDim.byMass(rads, dens)[source]¶

Returns a mass abscissa for plots.

oneDim.customFormatter(factor, prec=1, width=2)[source]¶

specialized format for plotting labels: width(prec) x 10^factor.

oneDim.fileProfile(fname, species=['he4 ', 'c12 ', 'o16 ', 'ne20', 'mg24', 'si28', 's32 ', 'ar36', 'ca40', 'ti44', 'cr48', 'fe52', 'ni56'], thresh=1e-06, mrange=[0.0, 0.0], radius=50000000000.0, filetag='prof', show=False)[source]¶

plots a checkpoint file ray through the domain.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename of checkpoint.
  • species (list of str) – list of species names to plot.
  • thresh (float) – ymin for species fraction plot.
  • radius (float) – reach of ray.
  • mrange (list of float) – if set, change the mass range of the abundance plot.
  • filetag (str) – change prefix of png output files.
  • show (bool) – return figure instead of saving it to file.
oneDim.getDset(filename)[source]¶

Returns the yt dataset (not compatible with batch/parallel scripts)

oneDim.getExtrema(filename, flist=['density', 'temperature', 'pressure'])[source]¶

returns a list of tuples with extrema for given fields(flist).

oneDim.getProfData(filename)[source]¶

Returns arrays for radius, dens, temp and a matrix with abundances, as an ordered dictionary.

oneDim.getProps(profD)[source]¶

returns central dens, temp, rmin, rmax, volume and mass of a 1D profile.

oneDim.getRay(fname, radius=500000000000.0)[source]¶

returns a ray trace through the domain.

oneDim.getVelocities(filename)[source]¶

Returns positions of the shock, and both in an outer cj velocities for a file, plus the starting x_match. (xin, xout, cjin, cjout, float(ray.ds.current_time), ray.ds.parameters[‘x_match’])

oneDim.gridInfo(filename, silent=True)[source]¶

prints checkpoint file grid stats through yt.print_stats() method.

oneDim.locateShock(ray, vvv=True)[source]¶

returns index within ray of detected shock.

plots the percentage difference for diffkey for two filenames.

oneDim.plotter(ax, filename, key, xkey='Radius', label='', log=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

plots ‘key’ values from a data dictionary

oneDim.shock1D(rad, soundspeeds, inward=True)[source]¶

finds a shock in an array by detecting the last large variation within it that is larger than the mean of deltas.

oneDim.writeProf(filename, profD)[source]¶

writes a 1D profile dict to a file.

twoDim.bifold(fname, mhead=True, topfield='density', tlims=[0.1, 40000000.0], width=1100000000.0, botfield='temperature', blims=[30000000.0, 2000000000.0], lintop=False, show=False, linbot=False, name='')[source]¶

Plots 2 properties as a joined sphere.

twoDim.customFormatter(factor, prec=1, width=2)[source]¶

specialized format for plotting labels: width(prec) x 10^factor.

twoDim.fileProfile(fname, species=['he4 ', 'c12 ', 'o16 ', 'ne20', 'mg24', 'si28', 's32 ', 'ar36', 'ca40', 'ti44', 'cr48', 'fe52', 'ni56'], thresh=1e-06, mrange=[0.0, 0.0], angle=45, radius=5000000000.0, show=False)[source]¶

plots a checkpoint file ray through the domain.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename of checkpoint.
  • species (list of str) – list of species names to plot.
  • thresh (float) – ymin for species fraction plot.
  • mrange (list of float) – if set, change the mass range of the abundance plot.
  • angle (float) – angle of ray in degrees (measured from +y towards +x).
  • radius (float) – reach of ray.
  • show (bool) – return figure instead of saving it to file.

twoDim.locateShock(ray, vvv=True)[source]¶

returns index within ray of detected shock.

twoDim.mainProps(fname, mhead=True, grids=False, show=False, fields=['density', 'pressure', 'temperature'], linear=False, mins=[0.1, 1e+16, 30000000.0], maxs=[40000000.0, 6e+24, 2000000000.0])[source]¶

Plots the list of fields specified in yt.

Parameters:
  • fname (str) – filename to plot.
  • mhead (bool) – mark the position of the matchhead.
  • grids (bool) – overplot the grid structure.
  • show (bool) – return figure (true) or save to file (false)
  • fields (list of str) – list of named fields to plot.
  • linear (bool) – set linear or log scale(false).
  • mins (list of float) – minima of scale for each field.
  • maxs (list of float) – maxima of scale for each field.

_globals.colIter()[source]¶

Simple color/linestyle iterator. Colors selected from Sasha Trubetskoy’s simple 20 color list (based on metro lines) https://sashat.me/2017/01/11/list-of-20-simple-distinct-colors/

_globals.colIter2()[source]¶

Simple color iterator. Colors selected from Sasha Trubetskoy’s simple 20 color list (based on metro lines). https://sashat.me/2017/01/11/list-of-20-simple-distinct-colors/

Returns:(element number, capitalized name)
Return type:tuple of str
_globals.split(x, xsplit, inward=True)[source]¶

returns indices below or above xsplit and offset [0,1,2,3,4,5,6] inward True, xsplit 3: [0,1,2], 0 inward False, xsplit 3: [4,5,6], 4
